description.narrative: (Nepal): Hamro Samman (HS) works with the GON, civil society, and private sector partners to strengthen key relationships among stakeholders to combat trafficking in persons (TIP). Nepal continues to be a source, transit point, and destination for forced labor, sex trafficking, and other forms of TIP. The lack of coordination among the GON, civil society, and private sector, combined with the dearth of effective data collection and sharing among stakeholders continues to make Nepal an attractive environment for traffickers. With FY 2020 resources, HS will support an integrated data collection system at the national and sub-national levels; provide technical assistance to national and local committees for Combating Human Trafficking and help Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) with data collection, analysis, and communication; facilitate information sharing among CSOs, government, and law enforcement; form private sector partnerships to expand access to quality services for trafficking survivors and at-risk groups; strengthen anti-TIP advocacy plans; provide shelter and counselling services for the reintegration of trafficking victims; and expand access to legal resources for TIP survivors to improve the prosecution of perpetrators..Winrock International has 30 years of experience globally working with governments to leverage accurate, accessible data to better combat TIP through informed, evidence-based policy, and survivor services. By strengthening national and local level capacity to combat TIP, Nepal will be better able to disrupt criminal networks, reduce rights violations, and decrease regional and U.S. bound trafficking and human smuggling. HS supports Embassy Kathmandu's Integrated Country Strategy Mission Goal One: Promote American Security by supporting a stable, secure, democratic and sovereign Nepal and Mission Objective 1.1, Nepal's security sector institutions have enhanced capacity to counter threats to U.S. security interests. .

Objectives for Nepal: The project aims to strengthen Committees to Control Human Traffic at district and national level to collect and use trafficking data for better policy, enforcement and services; reach at-risk individuals through media campaigns; Government and CSO partners with improved capacity to deliver TIP services; Private sector partnerships actively providing services and referrals through TIP networks; at-risk individuals will have increased entrepreneurial skills and employment opportunities
